text: お疲れ様でした
translation: Thank you for your hard work.

vocabulary.meaning: thank you for your hard work (polite expression)

grammar: Polite fixed expression used when acknowledging someone's efforts or when parting after work.

text: シンジ君、起きなさい。いつまで学校休む気?
translation: Shinji-kun, wake up. How long are you planning to skip school?

vocabulary.meaning: to wake up, to get up
to rest, to be absent, to skip

grammar: ~なさい (command form), いつまで~気 (how long do you intend to~)

text: もう5日目よ。初号機はもう完全に治ってるのよ。 / パイロットのあなたがそんなことでどうするの? / シンジ君?
translation: It's already the fifth day. Unit-01 has already been completely repaired. / What are you going to do as the pilot if you're like this? / Shinji-kun?
grammar: ~ている (perfective/resultative state), ~のよ (feminine explanatory particle), どうするの (what will you do)

text: 家でか、無理もないわね
translation: Running away from home, huh? That's understandable.
grammar: ~もない (no wonder, not unreasonable), わね (feminine sentence-ending particle)

text: シンジ君! / うっ、あ、あの、えっと
translation: Shinji-kun! / Uh, ah, um, well...
grammar: Hesitation markers showing nervousness or uncertainty.

text: イカリ君と同じクラスの、アイダとスズハラと申します / アイダ君とスズハラ君
translation: We're Aida and Suzuhara from Ikari-kun's class. / Aida-kun and Suzuhara-kun.
grammar: ~と申します (humble self-introduction: 'we are called...')

text: はい、わし、僕が / スズハラです / もしかして初号機のエントリープラグに入った / はいその説はとんだご迷惑をおかけしました
translation: Yes, I, I'm / Suzuhara / Did you happen to get into Unit-01's entry plug? / Yes, I deeply apologize for the trouble I caused at that time.
grammar: もしかして (by any chance), とんだ (great, terrible - emphasizer), ご迷惑をおかけしました (formal apology)

text: 実はあれからイカリ君がずっと休んでらっしゃるので
translation: Actually, since then Ikari-kun has been absent the whole time, so...
grammar: ~ている (continuous state), ~ていらっしゃる (honorific form of ~ている)

text: 気になって身に寄らせてもらったんですが / シンジ君はね今ネルフの訓練施設にいるの / そうですか
translation: We were concerned so we came to visit / Shinji-kun is at NERV's training facility right now / I see.

vocabulary.meaning: to be concerned, to be worried

grammar: ~させてもらう (to receive permission to do), ~んですが (explanatory but...)

text: これ机にたまってたプリント / イカリ君 / わざわざ悪いよねありがとう
translation: These are the handouts that piled up on his desk / For Ikari-kun / Sorry to trouble you, thank you.
grammar: ~ていた (past continuous/resultative), わざわざ悪い (sorry for going out of your way)

text: ほな僕ら失礼します / イカリ君によろしくお伝えください / ええ、伝 / えるわ。 / じゃ。
translation: Well then, we'll excuse ourselves / Please give our regards to Ikari-kun / Yes, I'll tell him. / See you.
grammar: よろしくお伝えください (please convey my regards - polite request)

text: これは予想外の展開だ。 / えらいべっぴんさんやったな。
translation: This is an unexpected development. / She was quite a beauty, wasn't she?
grammar: やったな (Kansai dialect past form of だ + confirmation particle な)

text: 信じたバカ!
translation: You idiots believed it!
grammar: Past tense verb + noun as exclamation

text: バカ。
translation: Idiot.
grammar: Simple noun used as insult/expression of frustration

text: 長尾峠、長尾峠です。 / お出口、右側に変わります。
translation: Nagao Pass, this is Nagao Pass. / The exit will be on the right side.
grammar: ~に変わります (will change to~) - polite announcement form

text: 本日は第三新東京市第七環状線をご利用いただき誠にありがとうございます
translation: Thank you very much for using Tokyo-3 Seventh Loop Line today.
grammar: ご~いただき (humble receiving form), 誠にありがとうございます (formal thank you)

text: この電車は当駅にて改造電車となります
translation: This train will become a returning train at this station.

vocabulary.meaning: return, reversal (in context: 折り返し)

grammar: ~となります (will become~) - formal announcement pattern

text: どちら様もお忘れ物のないようにご降車ください
translation: Please ensure you don't leave any belongings behind when you exit.
grammar: ~ないように (so that not~), ご~ください (polite request)

text: 帰らなきゃ / お姉さん! / お姉さん!お姉さん! / 本当に安いんだ!
translation: I have to go back / Miss! / Miss! Miss! / It's really cheap!
grammar: ~なきゃ (contraction of ~なければ: must, have to), ~んだ (explanatory emphasis)

text: ジュールからクエストそうです! / ジュールからクエストそうです!
translation: Jewel from Quest, that's right! / Jewel from Quest, that's right!
grammar: Advertising/sales pitch pattern (unclear product names in anime context)

text: 本当に探知できなかったんですか? / そうだ!直径数十ミリの物体が / 高速の数十パーセントという / 速度で / 南京に撃突したのだ!
translation: You really couldn't detect it? / That's right! An object with a diameter of several tens of millimeters / struck Antarctica at a speed / of several tens of percent of light speed!
grammar: ~できなかった (could not~), という (quotative/specification particle), ~のだ (explanatory emphasis)

text: 我々の科学では余地も防ぐこともできなかったんだ! / 外は地獄よ! / これじゃ何のための科学なの?
translation: With our science, we couldn't predict or prevent it! / It's hell outside! / What's the point of science if this happens?
grammar: ~も~も (neither~nor~), ~んだ (explanatory emphasis), 何のための (what is the purpose of)

text: 現在、耳熟変化による大気流動量3%に減少しました / じゃあ、お / 父さんが死にたほかしら / ダメです、罪が来ます / 秒速230メートルで接近しろ / 先生、 / 落 / ちしましょう
translation: Currently, atmospheric flow volume has decreased to 3% due to thermal changes / Then, has / Father died? / No good, danger is coming / Approaching at 230 meters per second / Teacher, / let's / evacuate
grammar: ~による (due to~), ~しました (polite past), ~かしら (feminine wondering particle)

text: さあ、私にはここに留まる義務がある / 先生、死ぬことは簡単です
translation: Now, I have a duty to remain here / Teacher, dying is easy.
grammar: ~にはある (to have [for someone]), ~ことは~です (as for doing~, it is~)

text: しかし、あなたには世界の地獄を見つめる義務がある
translation: However, you have a duty to witness the world's hell.
grammar: ~には~がある (for [someone], there is~)

text: 14歳だもんね / 人類の存亡を背負わせるのはやっぱり酷よね
translation: He is 14 years old after all / Making him shoulder the fate of humanity is really cruel, isn't it?

vocabulary.meaning: to carry on one's back, to shoulder

grammar: ~だもんね (casual explanatory: after all~), ~せる (causative: to make someone do), やっぱり (as expected, really)

text: でも私たちはエヴァの操縦を / 14歳の子供たちに委ねざるを得ないのよ / わかってる / で? / シンジ君から連絡は?
translation: But we have no choice but to entrust Eva's operation to 14-year-old children. I know. So? Have you heard from Shinji?

vocabulary.meaning: cannot help but, have no choice but to

grammar: ざるを得ない - expressing no choice or alternative (must do something despite not wanting to)

text: ないの?
translation: Nothing?
grammar: の - question particle adding emphasis or seeking confirmation

text: ないわ / 彼もう戻らないかもしれない / どうするつもり?
translation: Nothing. He might not come back. What are you going to do?
grammar: かもしれない - expressing possibility or uncertainty (might/may)

text: 別に戻らないならその方がいいかも
translation: Actually, it might be better if he doesn't come back.

vocabulary.meaning: maybe, might (shortened from かもしれない)

grammar: なら - conditional 'if'; その方が - that way/alternative (comparison)

text: ノズこの間の戦闘の後でさ
translation: You know, after that battle the other day...
grammar: さ - sentence-ending particle for casual emphasis or to get attention

text: どうして私の命令を無視したの? / ごめんなさい
translation: Why did you ignore my orders? I'm sorry.
grammar: の - explanatory/questioning particle seeking explanation

text: あなたの作戦責任者は私でしょ? / はい / あなたには私の命令に従う義務があるの / わかるわね? / はい / こういうことのないように / はい
translation: I'm your tactical commander, right? Yes. You have a duty to follow my orders. You understand, right? Yes. Make sure this doesn't happen again. Yes.

vocabulary.reading: さくせんせきにんしゃ

grammar: でしょ - confirmation particle (right?); ように - expressing purpose or instruction (so that)

text: あんた本当に分かってんでしょうね / はい
translation: You really understand, don't you? Yes.
grammar: てんでしょうね - contracted form of ているでしょうね (do/are...right?) with strong expectation

text: あんたね何でも適当にはいはい言ってりゃいいってもんじゃないわよ / 分かってますよちゃんと
translation: You know, you can't just casually say 'yes, yes' to everything and think that's good enough. I understand properly.
grammar: りゃ - contracted conditional form; ってもんじゃない - it's not as simple as just doing X

text: もういいじゃないですか勝ったんだから / そうやって表面だけ人に合わせていれば楽でしょうけどね
translation: Isn't it fine already since we won? It may be easy just superficially going along with people like that, but...

vocabulary.meaning: to match, to go along with

grammar: んだから - explanatory emphasis (since/because); ていれば - if you keep doing; でしょうけどね - softened criticism (may be...but)

text: そんな気持ちでエヴァーに乗ってたら死ぬわよ / いいですよ / そんなの
translation: If you pilot Eva with that kind of attitude, you'll die. That's fine. Something like that.
grammar: てたら - conditional continuation (if you keep doing); わよ - feminine emphatic particle

text: いい覚悟だわと言いたいとこだけど / 褒められると思ったら大間違いよ 怒りしんじくん / 褒められるものにも / どうせ僕しか 乗れないんでしょ
translation: I'd like to say that's admirable resolve, but if you think you'll be praised, you're dead wrong, Shinji. Even if it were praiseworthy... Anyway, I'm the only one who can pilot it, right?
grammar: と言いたいとこだけど - I'd like to say...but; と思ったら - if you think (with implication of being wrong)

text: 乗りますよ
translation: I'll pilot it.
grammar: ますよ - polite future/intention with emphasis

text: なるほど / ね
translation: I see. Right.
grammar: ね - seeking agreement or confirmation

text: あの子にとってエヴァに乗ることが 苦痛でしかないのならもう乗らない / 方がいいわ
translation: If piloting Eva is nothing but suffering for that child, then it's better if he doesn't pilot anymore.
grammar: でしかない - emphasis that something is only/nothing but; なら - conditional if

text: 絶対死ぬもの / でもパイロットは必要よ
translation: He'll definitely die. But we need a pilot.
grammar: もの - explanatory particle expressing reason or assertion

text: なったなったなったなったドアー / ッ!
translation: [Sound effects/battle scene dialogue]
grammar: Audio appears to be from a TV show/movie scene being watched

text: 招待所殿!
translation: Captain! [from TV show]
grammar: 殿 - formal/military honorific suffix

text: 行くんだ! / しかし自分は招待所殿を置いては進めません!
translation: Go! But I cannot proceed leaving you behind, Captain! [from TV show]
grammar: んだ - emphatic command; ては - if doing (negative implication); cannot do X if leaving you

text: バカの! / あー!
translation: You fool! Ahhh! [from TV show]
grammar: の - emphatic/emotive particle (often used in exclamations)

text: よっと。
translation: Alright then.
grammar: と - quotative/exclamatory particle

text: ん?
translation: Hm?
grammar: Interjection expressing questioning or noticing something

text: 天皇生?
translation: A transfer student?
grammar: Rising intonation for question

text: イカリー!
translation: Ikari!
grammar: Long vowel extension for calling out to someone

text: 当時の奴さ、反省してた
translation: You know, Toji was reflecting on it.
grammar: さ - casual emphasis particle; てた - casual past continuous

text: 妹に説教されたらしいよ / 私たちを救ってくれたのはあのロボットなのよって
translation: Apparently his little sister lectured him. She said 'That robot is what saved us, you know.'
grammar: らしい - hearsay/conjecture (apparently); のは...なの - explanatory emphasis (it's...that); って - quotation particle

text: 小学校低学年に説教されんなってのほんと / な
translation: Getting lectured by a lower elementary school kid, seriously.
grammar: されんな - Kansai dialect negative command form meaning 'don't get/be ~ed'; ってのほんと - colloquial for 'that's really...'

text: 夜はいいよな / あのうるさいセミが鳴かないから
translation: Nighttime is nice. Those noisy cicadas don't cry.
grammar: よな - casual masculine agreement particle; から - indicates reason/cause

text: 小さい頃は静かでよかったけど毎年増えてる
translation: When I was small it was quiet and nice, but they're increasing every year.
grammar: でよかった - past tense of でいい (was good/nice); てる - contraction of ている (progressive/continuous form)

text: 生態系が戻ってるってミサトさんが言ってた
translation: Misato-san said that the ecosystem is recovering.
grammar: てるって - contraction of ていると (quotative particle); 言ってた - past progressive of 言う

text: うーんミサトさんね / まったく羨ましいよ
translation: Hmm, Misato-san, huh? I'm totally envious.
grammar: ね - particle for confirmation or emphasis; よ - assertion particle

text: あんな綺麗なお姉さんと一緒に住んでて / エヴァンゲリオンを操縦できて / 一度でいいから
translation: Living together with such a beautiful lady, and being able to pilot Evangelion... Just once would be fine, so...
grammar: てて - repetition of て form for listing multiple states/actions; でいいから - 'just/only ~ would be fine, so...'

text: 思いのままにエヴァンゲリオンを操ってみたい / やめたほうがいいよ / お母さんが心配するから
translation: I want to try controlling Evangelion as I please. / You should stop that. / Because your mother would worry.
grammar: てみたい - want to try doing ~; たほうがいい - had better ~, should ~

text: ああそれなら大丈夫 / 俺そういうのいないから
translation: Ah, if that's the case, it's fine. I don't have anyone like that.
grammar: そういうの - 'that kind of thing/person'; いない - 'don't have/exist' (animate)

text: イカリと一緒だよ
translation: Same as Ikari.
grammar: と一緒 - same as ~, together with ~

text: 飯食うだろ
translation: You'll eat, right?
grammar: だろ - casual form of だろう (presumptive/confirmatory)

text: いつもこんなことしてんの / ん?うーん、 / まあな
translation: Do you always do stuff like this? / Hm? Well... / Yeah, pretty much.
grammar: してんの - contraction of しているの (are you doing...?); な - casual affirmative particle

text: ゲリラ戦にでもなった時の / ための訓練
translation: Training for when it becomes guerrilla warfare or something.
grammar: にでもなった - 'even if it becomes ~'; 時のための - 'for the time when ~'

text: こんなおもちゃで何ができるんだよ / 好きでやってるだけさ
translation: What can you even do with toys like this? / I'm just doing it because I like it.
grammar: 何ができるんだよ - 'what can (you) do...?' (rhetorical); 好きでやってる - 'doing because (I) like it'; さ - casual emphatic particle

text: イカリー シンジ君だね / はい / ネルフ保安庁法部のものだ。
translation: Ikari Shinji-kun, right? / Yes. / We're from NERV's Security & Legal Department.
grammar: だね - confirmation particle; のものだ - formal way to say 'we are from ~'

text: 保安条例第8項の適用により、君を本部まで連行する。いいね。 / はい。
translation: By application of Article 8 of the Security Regulations, we will escort you to headquarters. Understood? / Yes.
grammar: により - by means of, due to (formal); いいね - 'understood?, okay?'

text: そんでお前、黙って見てただけやっち / ゅんかい。
translation: And you, you just silently watched, is that it?
grammar: 黙って - te-form of adverb meaning 'silently'; 見てただけ - 'just watched'; やっちゅんかい - Kansai dialect emphatic question

text: なこと言ったって、向こうはネルフの保安庁法部、プロなんだよ。 / それ / がどないしたんや!お前それでもまたんきついとんのか! / やだ、 / えったい。
translation: Even if you say that, they're NERV's Security & Legal Department, they're professionals. / So what! Are you still claiming to be a man despite that! / No way, absolutely not.
grammar: 言ったって - even if you say; どないしたんや - Kansai dialect 'so what?'; それでも - 'even so, despite that'; んか - Kansai question particle

text: 勝てない喧嘩する奴は馬鹿なの / まあ短期は関係ないの
translation: People who pick fights they can't win are idiots. / Well, having a short temper has nothing to do with it.
grammar: 勝てない喧嘩 - 'a fight one can't win'; する奴 - 'person who does ~'; 関係ない - 'has nothing to do with, unrelated'

text: しばらくね / はい / この二日間ほっつけ歩いて気が晴れたかしら / 別に / エヴァのスタンバイできてるわ / 乗る?
translation: It's been a while. / Yes. / Did wandering around for these two days clear your head? / Not really. / The Eva's on standby. / Will you pilot it?

vocabulary.meaning: to feel refreshed, clear one's mind

grammar: ほっつけ歩いて - 'wandering around'; かしら - feminine wondering particle; できてる - 'is ready/done'

text: 乗らないの?
translation: You won't pilot it?
grammar: 乗らないの - negative question seeking confirmation

text: 叱らない / んですね / 家出のこと
translation: You're not going to scold me. About running away from home.
grammar: 叱らないんですね - explanatory のです with confirmation ね; 家出のこと - 'about running away from home'

text: 当然ですよね / 美里さんは他人なんだから
translation: Of course, right? Because Misato-san is just a stranger.
grammar: 当然ですよね - 'of course/naturally, right?'; なんだから - emphatic explanatory 'because ~'

text: もし僕が乗らないって言ったら / 初号機はどうするんですか / レインが乗るでしょうね
translation: If I said I won't pilot it, what would happen to Unit-01? / Rei would pilot it, I suppose.
grammar: って言ったら - 'if I said ~'; どうする - 'what will you do about ~'; でしょうね - presumptive 'probably/I suppose'

text: 乗らないの
translation: You won't pilot it?
grammar: 乗らないの - negative question with explanatory の

text: そんなことできるわけないじゃないですか / 彼女に全部押し付けるなんて / 大丈夫ですよ / 乗りますよ / 乗りたくないの? / そりゃそうでしょ。
translation: There's no way I could do that. Pushing everything onto her... / It's fine. / I'll pilot it. / Don't you want to pilot it? / Well, of course not.
grammar: わけないじゃないですか - 'there's no way, right?'; なんて - 'things like ~' (dismissive); たくない - negative desire

text: 大地、僕には向いてませんよ、そういうの。 / だけど、綾波や美里さんや律子 / さん… / いい加減にしなさいよ! / 人のことなんか関係ないでしょ! / 嫌ならここから出てきなさい!
translation: First off, I'm not suited for that kind of thing. / But, Ayanami and Misato-san and Ritsuko-san... / Enough already! / Other people have nothing to do with it! / If you don't like it, get out of here!
grammar: 向いてません - 'not suited for'; や - listing particle; なんか - dismissive 'something like ~'; でしょ - presumptive seeking agreement; なら - conditional 'if'

text: エヴァや私たちのことは全部忘れて、元の生活に戻りなさい!
translation: Forget all about Eva and us, and go back to your old life!
grammar: Command form なさい (nasai) creates a strong but feminine imperative. Pattern: Verb stem + なさい

text: あんたみたいな気持ちで乗られんのは迷惑よ!
translation: Having you pilot with that kind of attitude is a nuisance!
grammar: Passive form 乗られる used to express receiving an unwanted action. ~んの is a contraction of ~のの (nominalizer)

text: サードシルドレンは明日第三新東京を離れます / では初号機のデータはレイに書き換える / しかし
translation: The Third Child will leave Tokyo-3 tomorrow. / Then we'll rewrite Unit-01's data to Rei. / However...

vocabulary.meaning: to leave, to be separated from

grammar: では marks transition to a new decision or topic. Formal-polite ます form used in business/military context

text: ゼロ号機の再起動実験の結果の遺憾によらず / 初号機での実験に移る
translation: Regardless of the results of Unit-00's reactivation test, we'll move to testing with Unit-01.

vocabulary.meaning: to move to, to shift to

grammar: ~によらず means 'regardless of'. Dictionary form 移る used for declarative statement by authority figure

text: マルドゥク機関の報告によると / フォースチルトレンはまだ見つかっていない
translation: According to the Malduk Agency's report, the Fourth Child has not been found yet.
grammar: ~によると means 'according to'. ていない is negative present progressive indicating ongoing state

text: パイロットの補充は効かないということですか
translation: Does that mean we can't get a replacement pilot?

vocabulary.meaning: it means that, in other words

grammar: ~ということですか asks for confirmation of understanding. Negative potential 効かない indicates impossibility

text: ミサトさんは / どこですか / 一言お別れを / 君はすでにネルフの人間ではない / どのようなことも教えられない
translation: Where is Misato-san? / I'd like to say goodbye. / You are no longer a NERV employee. / We cannot tell you anything.
grammar: Potential negative 教えられない expresses inability/refusal. ではない is formal negative copula

text: ヒカリ 忘れ物や
translation: Hikari, you forgot something!
grammar: や is Kansai dialect version of よ or だよ, adding emphasis or alerting someone

text: あの ちょっといいですか
translation: Um, do you have a moment?
grammar: ちょっといいですか is a polite way to ask for someone's time or attention

text: あのありがとう
translation: Um, thank you.
grammar: Simple gratitude expression with hesitation marker あの

text: トウジ / 喋れよ / ほら
translation: Toji, say something! / Come on.
grammar: Imperative + よ urges someone to do something. ほら is used to prompt action

text: イカリ2発もどついたりして悪かった / わしのこともどついてくれ / そんなことできないよ / 頼むせやないとわしの気が / 済まん / こういう恥ずかしいやつなんだよ
translation: Ikari, I'm sorry for hitting you twice. / Hit me back too. / I can't do that. / Please, otherwise I won't feel right. / He's just this kind of embarrassing guy.

vocabulary.meaning: to feel satisfied, to feel settled

grammar: ~たりして lists actions among others. せやないと is Kansai for そうじゃないと (otherwise)

text: まそれで丸く収まるんなら殴ったら
translation: Well, if that'll settle things, then hit him.

vocabulary.meaning: to be settled peacefully, to be resolved

grammar: ~なら indicates conditional 'if'. たら is conditional suggestion form

text: でも… / 早よ!時間ないんや / ろ? / じゃ、一発だけ / よし!今回!
translation: But... / Hurry up! We don't have time! / Right? / Okay, just one punch. / Alright! Come on!
grammar: 早よ is Kansai dialect for 早く. ~んや is Kansai for ~んだ (explanatory tone)

text: 待った!
translation: Wait!
grammar: Past tense used as exclamation to call timeout or halt action

text: 手加減なしや
translation: Don't hold back!

vocabulary.meaning: going easy on someone, holding back

grammar: なし means 'without'. や is Kansai particle for emphasis

text: 痛ったったったった
translation: Ow ow ow ow!
grammar: Repetition of 痛っ (shortened いたい) emphasizes continued pain

text: どうしてここが / 艦ってやつだよ
translation: How did you know I'd be here? / It's called intuition.

vocabulary.meaning: the thing called, it's what you call

grammar: ってやつ is colloquial for というもの, used to explain or label something casually

text: ここんとこ何十人て同級生を見送ってきたんだ
translation: I've seen off dozens of classmates from here lately.

vocabulary.meaning: to see off, to send off

grammar: ~てきた indicates action continuing from past to present. んだ adds explanatory tone

text: 怒りがおらんのや / ったら / いずれわしらもこの町から出て行かんならんようなるやろう
translation: If you weren't here... / Eventually we'll probably have to leave this town too.
grammar: おらん = いない. ~んならん = しなければならない (must). やろう = だろう (probably)

text: せやけどわしら何も言われへん / 今の中で苦しんでる怒りの姿、見てるからな。
translation: But we can't say anything. / Because we've seen you suffering right now, Ikari.

vocabulary.meaning: to suffer, to be in pain

grammar: せやけど = だけど. 言われへん = 言えない (potential negative). ~てる = ~ている (ongoing state)

text: 怒りのことをごちゃごちゃ抜かす奴が追ってみ! / わしがパチキかましたる!
translation: If anyone badmouths you, Ikari, just you watch! / I'll headbutt them!
grammar: ~てみ is Kansai imperative 'try and see'. ~たる is Kansai for ~てやる (I'll do it for you)

text: そない、しんきくさい顔すんなよ! / 元気でな。 / 頑張れよ。 / あのっ!
translation: Don't make such a gloomy face! / Take care. / Do your best! / Um!

vocabulary.meaning: to do one's best, to persevere

grammar: すんな = するな (negative imperative). でな = でね (farewell particle). 頑張れ is imperative form

text: 時間だ。
translation: It's time.
grammar: Simple declarative statement with だ copula

text: 女の一から / よし!
translation: From one woman... / Alright!
grammar: から indicates source or starting point. よし is an interjection of determination or approval

text: こら! / 亡くなれなきゃならないの、僕だ! / あ、僕は卑怯で、奥病で、強くて、弱まして…
translation: Hey! / I'm the one who has to fight! / I'm cowardly, timid, pretentious, and weak...
grammar: なければならない - expresses obligation or necessity ('must', 'have to'). で connects adjectives in a list.

text: これ以上、手を焼かせるな。
translation: Don't cause me any more trouble.

vocabulary.meaning: to have one's hands full, to be troubled by

grammar: Causative form 焼かせる + な (negative imperative) = 'don't make me...'

text: 行っちゃったわね
translation: He went and left, didn't he.
grammar: ちゃう is the colloquial form of てしまう expressing completion or regret. わね is feminine sentence ending expressing confirmation.

text: これでよかったの?
translation: Was this the right thing to do?

vocabulary.meaning: was good (past tense of いい)

grammar: の at the end makes it a question seeking explanation or confirmation.

text: 山嵐のジレンマか
translation: The hedgehog's dilemma, huh.
grammar: か at the end expresses contemplation or confirmation, like 'huh' or 'I see'.

text: 身を寄せるほど相手を傷つける
translation: The closer you get, the more you hurt the other person.

vocabulary.meaning: to draw near, to get close

grammar: ほど indicates degree or extent - 'the more... the more...'

text: こういうことか
translation: So that's what it means.
grammar: か at the end expresses realization or understanding.

text: あの子
translation: That child...
grammar: Trailing off indicates incomplete thought or emotion.

text: ああいう言い方でしか自分の気持ちを伝えられないんだわ
translation: He can only express his feelings in that kind of way.

vocabulary.meaning: way of saying, manner of expression

grammar: でしか means 'only by/with'. られない is potential negative form ('cannot'). んだわ is feminine explanatory ending.

text: 2番線の厚木行き特急リニアが前にかす / 危ないですから / 黄色線の / 内側までおさまいください
translation: The express linear train bound for Atsugi on platform 2 is approaching. / Please be careful. / Please stay inside the yellow line.
grammar: Standard train station announcement format. ください is polite request form.

text: 2番線の電車は / 4時20分発厚木行きの / 政府専用特別列車です
translation: The train on platform 2 is the 4:20 special government train bound for Atsugi.
grammar: です is the polite copula. の connects multiple noun modifiers.

text: 一般の方は柵の内側には入れません / なお許可のない方のご乗車は固く禁じられております / くれぐれもご注意ください
translation: General passengers cannot enter inside the barrier. / Also, boarding without permission is strictly prohibited. / Please be especially careful.
grammar: られております is the polite passive form expressing prohibition. くれぐれも emphasizes 'especially/particularly'.

text: 頑張ってね
translation: Good luck, okay?

vocabulary.meaning: to do one's best, to persevere

grammar: てね is a gentle encouraging ending, combining て-form with ね particle.

text: 電話
translation: Telephone (opening theme song)
grammar: This is the title of the opening theme song that plays during this segment.

text: まもなく4番線に豪雨駅各駅停車が参ります
translation: The local train stopping at every station bound for Gouu Station will soon arrive at platform 4.
grammar: 参ります is the polite humble form used in announcements for approaching trains.

text: 危ないですから黄色い線の内側までお下がりください
translation: Please step back inside the yellow line as it is dangerous.

vocabulary.meaning: to step back, to move back

grammar: から indicates reason ('because it's dangerous'). お + verb stem + ください is very polite request form.

text: 小さいお子様をお連れの方は特にご注意ください
translation: Those with small children please be especially careful.
grammar: の方 means 'those who'. ご注意ください is very polite imperative ('please be careful').

text: 4番線路電車は4時32分発豪雨駅折り返しの各駅停車です
translation: The train on platform 4 is the 4:32 local train returning from Gouu Station.
grammar: 発 indicates departure time. の connects noun modifiers describing the train.

text: ご利用の皆様はご乗車になってお待ちください
translation: All passengers, please board and wait.
grammar: になって is the honorific te-form. お待ちください is polite imperative 'please wait'.

text: まもなく電車入ります / 黄色い線の内側まで下がってください
translation: The train is coming soon. / Please step back inside the yellow line.
grammar: 入ります is polite present/future form. てください is polite request form.

text: ただいま
translation: I'm home.
grammar: Standard greeting said when returning home.

text: おかえりなさい
translation: Welcome home.

vocabulary.meaning: welcome home (response to ただいま)

grammar: Standard greeting response to someone returning home.

text: 他人との接点を最小限にとどめ生きていく綾波玲 / 彼女 / が心を開くのは怒り司令だけだった / 自分より父に近い少女にシンジは戸惑う
translation: Rei Ayanami, who lives keeping contact with others to a minimum. The only person she opens her heart to is Commander Ikari. Shinji is confused by this girl who is closer to his father than he is.

vocabulary.meaning: to be confused, to be bewildered

grammar: のは...だけだった emphasizes 'the only one is...'. より indicates comparison 'more than'.

text: 次回 玲 心の向こうに
translation: Next episode: Rei, Beyond Her Heart
grammar: の向こうに means 'beyond/on the other side of'. Standard next episode preview format.

translation: (silence/end)
grammar: Placeholder segment marking the end.
